intro: Hesperidanthus barnebyi, commonly known as the Barneby's hesperidanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
